definitions: To cause to suffer great pain, either physical or mental.
To place in or on a rack.
To draw off (wine or beer) from the lees.
To hit (a ball) into a pocket in billiards or pool.
To arrange (pool balls) in a rack before a game.
examples: He racks the weights after his set.
She racks the eight ball for the win.
He racks the balls for the next game.
